array.string: Is the personal data I enter into Updates stored and managed securly?

Absolutely! When you tell Updates that you entered personal data when browsing to your page, everything you sent is encrypted using the password you specify. There's no way to decrypt your data without that password, and if you choose to save your password, it's stored securly in the iOS Keychain and is available only to Updates and only when your device is unlocked, so you don't have to worry!
How to I delete an Update when I'm finished with it?
Just swipe the Update to the side on the main screen, and you'll see a Delete button, similarily to many iOS apps. Just tap that button and you'll be good to go.
Updates isn't working well for me. What can I do?

I'm really sorry to hear that—like you may have read when you first opened this app, it's hard to get it working perfectly for every site. Just let us know what's not working (the Contact button on the previous page can help with that), and we'll do our best to make sure it's fixed in the future.\n\nThanks for your help!
Updates is working fantastically, and I don't need any help!

While this isn't strictly a "help" topic, if Updates is working well for you and has helped make your day a bit more efficient, then please consider leaving Updates a rating on the App Store—it helps other people find the app, and it helps us keep it updated and working, too!
What does the upgraded version of the app do, and how do I get it?

Update's upgrade system is incredibly simple, actually: by paying one dollar, you can have as many Updates as you want (rather than just three) on any of the devices on your account.

You'll have the option of upgrading whenever you try to add too many updates to the standard version.

Upgrading Updates really helps out its development, so thank you in advance!
